body: Use a vector instead of new (std::vector<int64_t> dims(num_dims), and then use dims.data() and dims.size()). I believe you are leaking dims, and using raw memory allocations like this is in general very dangerous.
body_html: Use a vector instead of new (std::vector<int64_t> dims(num_dims), and then use dims.data() and dims.size()). I believe you are leaking dims, and using raw memory allocations like this is in general very dangerous.
body_text: Use a vector instead of new (std::vector<int64_t> dims(num_dims), and then use dims.data() and dims.size()). I believe you are leaking dims, and using raw memory allocations like this is in general very dangerous.
